Articles.Content:

I got a Spitfire!!!

Had to get that out of my system
US:almost 6 Germany:6 Britain:almost 6 japan: half way to level 6 Russia: probably close to 6
Seven with Soviet (though I can't afford even the tier 6 planes yet. <.<), two with Britain and four with Japan. Been unable to play lately, though.
U.S.A: 7 Nazi Germany: 11 Soviet Union: 9 Britain: 6 Imperial Japan: 3
i recently unlocked the Wellington, played it for a bit and now have the 4000lb. this bomb is AWESOME
Lucky you. I've wanted to unlock the Wellington but haven't played much recently. It looks good.

What levels are people at?

Soviet 5, Japan 2, everything else 1.
What's everyone's opinion on the German biplanes
Ingame name rowns. highest lvl 8.

What's everyone's opinion on the German biplanes

Biplanes are very manoeuvrable but slow so good in a turn battle but useless trying to catch up with faster monoplanes.

Which nation should I start next? America, Russia or Japan?

What's everyone's opinion on the German biplanes

Maneuverability-wise, they're on par with all the other reserve biplanes. I believe they have the weakest guns, however.

Which nation should I start next? America, Russia or Japan?

Depends on your play-style. American planes are geared more towards boom and zoom, Japanese planes are very nimble and agile, and Russia is sort of in between.

Also, if you do go with America, keep in mind that the three reserve planes are not the same. The blue and yellow Peashooter only has .30 cal machine guns, whereas the other two also have .50 cals. This makes a particularly big difference with ground targets.

, and Russia is sort of in between.

FLASE

Russia has flying tanks that can ram, and destroy, other nations aircraft and keep going for 2 or 3 more.

Not good for much else though.

Soviet planes were built sturdy, yes. Their design philosophy was heavy armour and big guns, often said simply add "flying tanks". In the game, they're fairly durable, and heavily armed, but excel at strafing ground attacks.
@kevin really? they seem more agile to me.,
So, how are things going for everyone? Not outlevelling me, I hope.
No one dares to post, out of fear the thread may get deleted.
Rank 10 soviet Soon, yey.

US: Rank 13

Germany: Rank 9

Soviet: Rank 5

Britain: Rank 6

Japan: Rank 0

Kind of nice to see this game is growing, I played it back in the closed beta

Username is CaptainMack1 if anyone wants to squad up.

Been going Russian, Level 6 in it and I bought some Golden Eagles. and got a P-63. No regrets, amazing plane and amazing plane in real life.

And you're going to say you could have gone American, but I like Russian planes.

Haven't played in a couple of days. The glitch with the maps finally started to annoy me, and I had other things to take care of.

I'll come back to it in time.

>Flies mainly Ki-49-IIb/Late

>Wrecks absolutely everything in the Ki-49-IIb/Late

>Realizes the Ki-49-IIb/Late is almost identical to the Ki-49-IIb

> MFW I realize I can now technically fly TWO Ki-49-IIb/L's:
That's what I did with my Soviet bombers for a while. Three identical aircraft on the same tier is expensive and I don't care for it overall, but it does have good points sometimes.
that is how i use my wellington
Why do they have to have so many variants of the same aircraft which are barely different?
